intro: Lastrella, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to various regions in South America, particularly in the Andes mountains. The plants are typically small, terrestrial orchids with compact growth habits and often grow in rocky or mountainous environments. They produce showy, often brightly colored flowers that bloom during the warmer months. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value due to their unique and attractive floral structures.
